summary: Cant get it to load on Ubuntu

description: The app works great on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS! Also, using BorgBase's website as the backup repository is great! It's only 1GB but it should be sufficient enough for me. Plus, on the BorgBase website, it allows up to two repositories (devices) to be backed up. Overall, great application for a free, open-source backup solution!

It seemed so promising at first. But as soon as I was faced with setting up the Repositories, I just couldn't wrap my head around this concept. I found it very confusing, unlike any other backup program I have tried. It would have helped if there was documentation for Local backups, but there isn't :(
I may come back next year and try it again.
summary: It has potential. If it only wasn't as confusing

description: I have a local machine mounted to my main machine. I have tried entering every possible valid pathname to this local machine and Vorta still refuses to connect to it. Deja-Dup doesn't have that problem. I wanted to use Vorta and Borg due to the potential ease of setting up automatic backups to run at the day and time I want (something not possible with Deja-Dup), but I can't. Vorta was supposed to be the answer to my problem, but it only created more problems. What a waste of space.

summary: Don't know anything as powerful and convenient as this for backup

description: This is the backup software that you needed and you didn't know that you need. From average Joe to DevOps Joe, this backup tool is the most reliable, industry tested, with huge community.
Was excited about this, but when I go to select a source folder for backup, my entire machine freezes and crashes. Running KDE Neon 20.04.
summary: Doesn't work for me at all on KDE

description: Great application but selecting a source folder in KDE has recently caused the app to crash. I think this has to do with flatpak more than it has to do with Vorta, as Vorta installed from pip does not have this issue.
summary: Selecting a source folder in KDE crashes the application

description:
The GUI interface is not as well set out as it could be, very compact which is good from having it all on one screen. This results in having to click tabs to set up a repository rather than have several screens with next buttons.

Also does not show dot files/directories as a source unless included as a sub directory. Backing up .thunderbird for ones mail is not simple as it could be for an important file.

I have found that all is going well and then Vorta does not play nicely. Gives error messages. True probably as something I have done but having a backup throwing error messages is not something that one wants.

The scheduler works well once set up correctly.

One can restore a single file or all files in the backup. Does, deduplication, compression and well as encryption all behind the scenes.
summary: Good front end to borgbackup, workflow may not suit everyone

description: Borg is the system everyone should use for backups. It's secure and keeps size as small as possible. Love it. Vorta is a rudimentary client which will do, especially for users that don't want to fiddle with configs or CLI.
summary: Borg is the best backup system, Vorta a client that will do

description: easy to use front-end gui for borg.
No instructions needed, make +Profile, make +Ropo (destination of backup files) not on the same partition. Next, Sources tab, add +files or +folders, click (Start Backup) button.
summary: Best App ever, super simple to use

description: Wer eine einfache Lösung sucht, grafisch sein Borg-Backup zu erstellen bzw. zu verwalten, hat mit Vorta genau das gefunden was er suchte.
summary: Als GUI für borg sehr gut

description:
